content.description: Milk has a <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of 6.7, which is slightly acidic. Cheese makers add a culture to milk to lower the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, making it more acidic and turning it into cheese. A manufacturer is experimenting with a new culture that claims to produce a <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of 5.2, which is perfect for cheddar cheese. A set of 50 test batches resulted in an average <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of 5.11. A one-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test was conducted to investigate whether there is evidence that the mean <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is different from 5.2. The test resulted in a <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.018.
content.question: Which of the following is a correct interpretation of the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value?

choices.label: The probability that the true <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is equal to 5.2 is 0.018.
The probability that the true <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is different from 5.2 is 0.018.
The probability of observing a sample mean of 5.11 or less is 0.018 if the true mean is 5.2.
The probability of observing a sample mean of 5.11 or more is 0.018 if the true mean is 5.2.
The probability of observing a sample mean of 5.11 or less, or of 5.29 or more, is 0.018 if the true mean is 5.2.

content.answer: The probability of observing a sample mean of 5.11 or less, or of 5.29 or more, is 0.018 if the true mean is 5.2.

topic.text: 7.5: Carrying Out a Test for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
